intro: Coprosma australis, commonly known as the New Zealand gloryflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and often have a reddish or purple tinge on the underside. Coprosma australis is well adapted to a variety of soil types and is commonly found in forest understories and coastal areas.
